title: Interspect Routing Overrides
description: Agent exclusion and override configuration for flux-drive triage. Written by Interspect (lib-interspect.sh), read by flux-drive (SKILL.md Step 1.2a.0).

version.description: Schema version. Readers must reject version > 1.

overrides.description: Agent-level routing overrides. Each entry modifies how flux-drive dispatches one agent.

overlays.description: Prompt tuning overlays (placeholder — not yet implemented). Reserved for iv-6liz.

agent.description: Agent name to override. Must match fd-<name> format.

action.description: Override action. 'exclude' removes agent from triage. 'propose' marks a proposed-but-not-yet-active exclusion (used by /interspect:propose).

reason.description: Human-readable explanation of why this override exists.

evidence_ids.description: Interspect evidence IDs that motivated this override.

created.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when override was created.

confidence.description: Evidence strength at creation time (agent_wrong_pct / 100). Snapshot — does not update.

scope.description: Optional scope restriction. When absent, override applies globally.

approved.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when a proposal was promoted to exclude. Only present on entries that went through the propose→approve flow.

canary.description: Canary monitoring snapshot at creation time. DB is authoritative for live state.

domains.description: Domain names from flux-drive domain detection (e.g., 'claude-code-plugin', 'tui-app'). Override only applies when detected domain matches.

file_patterns.description: Glob patterns for file paths (e.g., 'interverse/**'). Override only applies when input files match. Patterns must not contain '..' or start with '/'.

status.description: Canary status at creation time. This is a snapshot — check /interspect:status for live state.

window_uses.description: Number of uses in the canary monitoring window.

expires_at.description: When the canary monitoring window expires.
